title: Salade Lyonnaise
description: A classic French warm salad from Lyon featuring frisée lettuce tossed with a mustardy vinaigrette, topped with crisp lardons and a soft-poached or fried egg. The salad balances bitter greens, smoky pork, tangy dressing and a runny yolk for richness.

ingredients.display_name: frisée or curly endive, torn into bite-sized pieces
thick-cut bacon or lardons, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
baguette, cut into 1/2-inch cubes for croutons

ingredients.notes: use if vinegar is very sharp

steps.text: Prepare ingredients: wash and dry the frisée, cut bread into cubes, mince the shallot, and cut bacon into lardons.
Make croutons: heat a skillet over medium heat, add butter, then toast bread cubes until golden and crisp, stirring frequently; transfer to paper towel to drain.

Cook lardons: in the same skillet (no need to wipe clean) over medium-high heat, add lardons and cook until deeply browned and crisp and fat is rendered; use a slotted spoon to transfer lardons to a plate and reserve the fat in the pan.

Vinaigrette: off-heat, combine minced shallot, Dijon mustard, red wine vinegar, salt, pepper and optional sugar in a bowl; whisk while slowly streaming in olive oil until emulsified. Taste and adjust seasoning.
Warm the dressing (optional): briefly return reserved bacon fat to low heat and stir a tablespoon into the vinaigrette for a slightly warm, glossy dressing; do not overheat.
Dress greens: place frisée in a large bowl, pour vinaigrette over and toss gently to coat evenly.

Poach or fry eggs: bring a shallow pan of water to a gentle simmer with a splash of vinegar to poach, then create a gentle whirlpool and slip in eggs one at a time, cooking until whites are set but yolks remain runny (about 3 minutes); alternatively fry eggs in a lightly oiled skillet until whites are set and yolk to desired doneness.

Assemble: divide dressed frisée among plates, sprinkle with warm lardons and croutons, season with extra pepper, and top each portion with a poached or fried egg. Serve immediately so yolk can be broken over the salad.
